intro: Elatostematoides gracilipes, commonly known as the slender leathery liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its flat, leaf-like structures called thallus, which are typically green and covered in a waxy cuticle. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Elatostematoides gracilipes reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporophytes. Its simple morphology and ecological adaptability make it an important species in studies of bryophyte ecology and evolution.
